0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• use of skin disinfectants containing quaternary ammonium salts should be avoid as hyaluronan precipitation may occur
  • Osteoarthritis of knee: (Synvisc(R)); inject 16 mg (2 mL) INTRA-ARTICULARLY into the knee once weekly for a total of 3 injections
  • Osteoarthritis of knee: (Synvisc-One(R)); inject 48 mg (6 mL) INTRA-ARTICULARLY into the knee

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients 21 years of age and younger

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• hypersensitivity to hyaluronan (sodium hyaluronate) preparations
  • infections in the area of the injection site
  • knee joint infections
  • skin diseases in the area of the injection site

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• allergy to avian-derived products (proteins, feathers, and egg products)
  • concomitant use with disinfectants containing quaternary ammonium salts is not recommended
  • intravascular, extra-articular injections, or injections into synovial tissues or capsule; local and systemic adverse events have occurred
  • lymphatic or venous stasis in the affected leg

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Musculoskeletal:Arthralgia (1.6% to 25.2%), Effusion of joint (1.6% to 5.7%), Knee pain (2.2% to 23.7%), Swelling of knee joint (2.2% to 23.7%)
Serious
Cardiovascular:Syncope

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Hylan G-F 20 (Synvisc(R)) is an elastoviscous fluid comprised of hylan A and B polymers produced from chicken combs. Hylans are derivatives of hyaluronan, also known as sodium hyaluronate. Hyaluronan is a natural substance present in very high amounts in joints and its actions as a lubricant enables the joint to work properly. While the exact mechanism of action of hylan polymers A and B is unknown, the elasticity and viscosity of hylan G-F 20 is comparable to the elasticity and viscosity of knee synovial fluid measured in humans of 18 to 27 years old.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Intra-articular
  • maintain strict aseptic technique
  • use an 18-gauge to 22-gauge needle to remove synovial fluid or effusion prior to administration; discard syringe
  • twist tip cap before pulling off to minimize product leakage
  • secure needle to hylan G-F 20 syringe using the same needle used to remove synovial fluid or effusion
  • use immediately after removal from packaging
  • use in one knee only

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: reduction in pain associated with osteoarthritis of the knee is indicative of efficacy

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Synvisc Hylan GF
    Injection Solution: 8 MG/ML
  • Synvisc
    Injection Solution: 8 MG/ML
  • Synvisc One
    Injection Solution: 8 MG/ML

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Instruct patient to avoid strenuous or prolonged weight-bearing activity for 48 hours after intra-articular injection.
  • Drug may cause arthritis, arthralgia, arthropathy, injection-site pain, and joint stiffness, swelling, warmth, or effusion.
  • Instruct patient to immediately report significant leg swelling or signs/symptoms of blood clots.
